meanings.definition: Covered with or consisting of furze.
meanings.sent1: The furzy field was a golden sea of prickly bushes.
meanings.sent2: The path through the furzy meadow was lined with yellow flowers.
meanings.sent3: The sheep avoided the furzy hill, afraid of getting tangled in the thorny bushes.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a furzy blanket, warm and prickly.
meanings.sent5: The air was filled with the sweet scent of furzy blooms.

meanings.sent1: The furzy texture of the fabric reminded her of the soft prickles of furze.
meanings.sent2: His furzy hair stuck out in all directions, just like the furze bushes in the field.
meanings.sent3: The furzy clouds in the sky looked like fluffy pillows made of thorns.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a furzy quality, rough yet comforting.
meanings.sent5: The furzy pattern on the wallpaper added a cozy touch to the room.

meanings.sent1: The furzy landscape stretched as far as the eye could see, covered in yellow blooms.
meanings.sent2: The furzy hills were alive with the buzzing of bees among the bushes.
meanings.sent3: The furzy countryside was a maze of prickly paths and hidden clearings.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a furzy thicket, full of tangled thoughts and ideas.
meanings.sent5: The furzy fields whispered in the wind, a symphony of rustling leaves.
